intro: Cousinia gedrosiaca, commonly known as the Gedrosian hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and silver-gray foliage, which helps it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to high temperatures and low precipitation. Cousinia gedrosiaca is often found in desert margins and is an important component of semi-arid ecosystems.
